availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Created on April 28, 1863, as the United States Invalid Corps. Name changed to the Veteran Reserve Corps on March 18, 1864. Employed physically disabled soldiers in noncombatant roles such as garrison and hospital duty, though some engaged in combat as well. Disbanded on August 28, 1866. Commander(s): General Winfield Scott Hancock (November 1864-August 1866).

ab.bibl:
“War Department. Provost Marshal General's Bureau. Invalid Corps. 4/28/1863-3/18/1864
Organization Authority Record,” National Archives Catalog, NARA, https://catalog.archives.gov/id/10461967 (accessed March 31. 2021).
Official Army Register of the Volunteer Force of the United States for the Years 1861–1865, part 8 (Adjutant General’s Office, 1867), p. 30–119.
Margaret E. Wagner, Gary W. Gallagher, Paul Finkelman, eds., The Library of Congress Civil War Desk Reference (New York: Simon & Schuster, 2002), 441-42.
